title: Does anyone experience moments where it seems everything is frozen as if time doesn't exist? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s said that in the spiritual realm time is conspicuous by it’s absence. I’ve found that when I go deep into meditation I’ll sometimes experience a very brief moment when time ceases to exist and everything is somehow intransient and immutable. It’s sort of like seeing a teeny tiny light at the end of a tunnel but it’s enough to kindle renewed enthusiasm and abundant energy every time it happens.

I have experienced discordant time not exactly frozen but slowed down so much it was almost frozen for two incidents. One was during a close call in traffic. The other was during my Enlightenment experience where during the space of about a second and a half in physical time I had so much experience that it can sometimes take me as long as four hours to give a detailed account of what I experienced.
I think I have been through sufficient dramatic moments in my life, being part of two wars. However, I have never observed this. I believe this is just limited to the movies
